Reviews.Title: “Not bad, just location location location”
Reviews.Author: Sofiztikated
Reviews.Content: Myself and the good lady wife stayed here in early March. Getting to and from the hotel to the airport was painless. Got off the bus at the IBM stop, as directed on the hotels website. However, from there, no real indication of where to go. However, my awesome sense of direction, and guesswork, got us there. :D Nothing really in the area, just offices. Check in was grand, no problems. Room was nice, a touch smaller than I was expecting, but no issues. Breakfast was nice, the little pancake things were great! While we were there, they were redoing their lobby art thing, so the art side of things wasn't represented well. Snack type things were pricey, â‚¬3 for a 500ml Coke. On departure, we wanted to kill some time before we got our flight to the airport, but they don't really have anywhere you can just lounge. Bar/breakfast area is tables and chairs, there are some couch type things between the lobby and the bar area, so we sat there. Not comfortable, but adequate. It was easy getting in and out of the city, tram was only 15 minutes away, but after that, it was a 25 minute ride into town on the number 2. Not a hassle, but just far enough to take a chunk of of your day. We went into the city in the morning, and were there for the day. All staff I met were pleasant, and fluent in English. If I was on business, it would have been grand, but as a city explorer base, just that smidge too far for me.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel to be recommended absolutely 100%!”
Reviews.Author: miaBrighton v
Reviews.Content: a sleek looking hotel, very very comfortable, excellent breakfast, excellent service - best bit - the lovely, friendly extremely helpful staff. the hotel is not right in the city centre but this was a bonus - it was a 10 min taxi journey to the airport and 7 min walk to the tram stop - tram passes sold from reception at the hotel and the tram journey in to the centre is so easy - on the number 2 line which takes about 20minutes to the van gogh museum and vondel park a thoroughly enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - outside the city.”
Reviews.Author: Telfish1969
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotle March 2012 for 3 nights. We upgraded our room to a superior double and were not disapointed. Overall the hotel was great, the staff were friendly, the hotel was very clean and the lay out is fantastic. We had the usual amenites in our room a trouser press kettle tv ect. and the food in the hotel was top class.The bus stop is just behind the hotel ( number 45 ) a 2 minutes away, but it does not go to the city centre. The tram is about 15 minutes away a good walk but easy to find. We realy enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam and will go back, there`s lots to see and do for all types of groups. There are all types of museum`s and parks.The city centre is full of shops bars and coffee shops. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Short Break”
Reviews.Author: Donna G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Saturday till Tuesday & had a lovely stay, nice rooms, great size & clean. We had a very early flight from U.K on Saturday morn which meant we arrived at hotel at 9.30am, we knew they would store our luggage but they actually upgraded us & the friends we were with & checked us in which was fab!! Helpful staff, 10 min walk to bus or tram stop, the reception staff helped us with the purchase of a 72 hour ticket which can be used for all the trams,buses & metro which was so handy, cost 16 euro s per person , great choice for breakfast, so you can fuel up for a long day in the town, would stay again. Down at customers toilets they had ace seats I would luv them for my house lol. Hotel taxi back to Airport 25 euro s cost us more coming from Airport using just normal taxi, if you are going book Hotel taxi to do your airport pick up you wont get better value.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with it!”
Reviews.Author: SofiaAP
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a short break in Amsterdam, which was amazing! Stayed for 2 nights in this hotel and really liked it. The design is amazing, staff was very friendly and helpful and our room was clean, quite big and fitted with a kettle and tea and coffee (we found it quite handy after a long day in the city). The only thing I didn't quite like was the mattress as It was too soft for my liking but apart from that everything was great. The hotel is about 20 mins on the tram no 2 (can get it at the central station and it's non stop to the Louwesweg stop), we found it very convenient as we got to see the outskirts of central Amsterdam and it runs until after midnight so it worked for us. From the tram stop to the hotel is about 10 mins walk through a residential area and a children's park, perfectly fine and safe. We really enjoyed overall and hope to go back again:)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing out of town hotel”
Reviews.Author: 5hellebelle
Reviews.Content: Shame about the 10 min tram journey & 10 min walk to this fabulous hotel, however, if it was in the city centr it'd be ten times the price. We quite enjoyed the little adventure to find it and once we did we weren't disappointed!! The rooms were really stylish, beautiful clean bathroom (no bath though). The hotel staff were very polite and friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed our night here. As transport in Amsterdam is so reliable with buses, trams and nighbuses the location wasn't a problem to us and gave opportunity to see the 'real' Amsterdam. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport but far from anything else”
Reviews.Author: lucabran
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 30 euros of taxi away from the airport, and another 30 to go in town. Rooms ok although bathroom is very small. Gym equipped with only few equipments, see puctures. No towels in the gym. Breakfast ok but extra. Wifi is free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Julie D
Reviews.Content: I was treated to this trip for my 40th Birthday & enjoyed every minute. Everyone from the Airport Staff to the local's were friendly. Best to by a 24/48/72 hour travel card from the Airport. Never been before but found the Hotel really easy on Public Transport (No 69 bus from outside the Airport then ask the driver to drop you off at the No2 tram stop) As for people complainng on here of the long walk from the tram to the Hotel it is rubbish. On the night we were dropped of we did walk the long way round but it took no more than 10 minutes but there is a cut through as you pass the bus stop at the back of the Hotel & it took at the most 7 minutes. The journey into the centre of town took the maximum of 25 minutes. Hotel was lovely & comfortable & as for the breakfast there was so much to chose from & we only paid Â£15 each extra for 3 days of breakfast from our Travel Agent. The only down fall is that if you wish to go shopping alot of them do not open until 1.00am but I think that's because it's such a laid back country. Can't wait to go again & would use this Hotel again. Don't be put off by the bad comments.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel centred around Fashion”
Reviews.Author: Elgalactico888
Reviews.Content: Overall a solid 4 star hotel, which was very clean. Went to an exhibition in Amsterdam, so this hotel is not located in the centre. Taxis are very expensive so it'll cost you more than you think to get out to the centre, however the tram and bus station is very close to the hotel and it's easy to get to the centre from there. Rooms were clean, bed reasonably comfortable and spacious. Was pretty expensive to buy water/drinks at the hotel so bring your own back

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend at Dutch Design Artemis Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miss_aholland
Reviews.Content: My partner and i had got a really good deal on secretescapes.co.uk for 3nights at this hotel in Amsterdam including free drink each on arrival and a 1hour sight seeing canal trip. It is 20-25minutes away from Central Amsterdam on bus. Hotel is very modern and displays works of arts around the lower ground, hence the name Artemis. Loads of interesting chairs to try sitting on. On Arrival we were pleasantly greeted and provided with useful travel information. The hotel has motorcycles and bikes to hire out front and taxis were always outside waiting. My partner and I chose to use Bus, there is a bus stop located 2minutes behind the hotel and takes no longer than 20mins to get in to town. Runs twice an hour. There is a fitness room which is free to you 24/7. Rooms where great, really modern fittings and shower, massive beds and loads of lighting. TV has BBC1, BBC2 and BBC worlds news. Over all really enjoyed the stay and use of room. Did not eat in restaurant or use room service as found prices where very expensive and over priced. 19Euros per person for breakfast buffer per day. Even snacks at reception where over priced 9euros for a large packet of walkers/lays crisps. NO local shops to be seen but i was informed there was one about 15minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Removed from city center, excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: NordicSnow
Reviews.Content: Ok, I agree that the hotel is located in the business district surrounded by the ilk of IBM and NCR but really, to have a four star hotel at half the cost of the city center hotels, it is not too much trouble at all. Just think of all the more exciting things you can do in Amsterdam with your money! The hotel is very modern having a Scandinavian feel. The rooms are extremely clean, as was the entire hotel, and do note that our room only had a shower stall, not a problem for us but perhaps if you had small children. The breakfast buffet had all one would expect, prepared very well, do try and get a package for at a separate cost of 19 euros each it is a tad steep.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel too far from centre”
Reviews.Author: joannehurley
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went to Amsterdam last year. We were recommended this hotel from Airmiles. The hotel was ok, an average 3/4 star. However, the hotel was around 1.5 miles to the closest bus/tram stop and then a 45 minute tram ride. We walked around Amsterdam during the day and by the afternoon when you want to go back and have a rest, we decided not to go back out into town as we could face the hour or so long journey each way. It really spoilt out trip and although I loved Amsterdam, I would not stay in this hotel again due to the walk and long tram ride.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Fresh and Great Value but not near the town”
Reviews.Author: Spongegod
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a very fresh look at the "design " aspect of things. It is situated in what appears to be a business district near PWC and IBM. It was about 30 euro from the airport. From chairs made of nails and tennis balls, the reception has it all. The staff were very friendly at check in and offered all the relevant advice regards our stay and the faciities. Round to the left of reception is a small lounge and bar area plus a restaurant. The breakfast is 19.50 euro and offers a cold/hot buffet. Nothing to complain about but the price could probably be more realistic at 15.00 euro. Evening meals offer a little more than you would think and the 3 pepper soup with Paprika was delicious. Followed by the Puy Lentil curry,again tasty and wholesome. The service was very good despite the restaurant being busy. For 4 of us, starters/mains plus a bottle of wine was 162 euro - Not cheap but by hotel standards, not too unrealistic either. Room service is also available if you don't fancy leaving the comforts of the bedroom. The beds are like the rest of the hotel. Trendy and functional. Chairs, desk and flat screen allow you to work or relax. The TV offers a selection of movies/music and internet( all chargeable). There is also a direct dial phone if you need it but I would suggest using your mobile, probably still cheaper!! Tea/Coffee and a mini bar( the mini bar is chargeable)round off the room. Shower and bath pair up with the toilet and too keep you cosy they have underfloor heating:) Wifi is free throughout the hotel( so why use the internet on the TV??) but can be slow if everyone is online. This hotel is good for a business traveller but not so good for those people wishing to visit Amsterdam to sight see. It will cost you about 25 euro to get into town each way and there didn't appear to bea tram in sight. Bear that in mind. Yes your City centre hotel may be dearer but deduct what you'd pay in transport and it'll probably work out the same.

Reviews.Title: “Really not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Mike C
Reviews.Content: The Artemis is not expensive but is in the middle of nowhere and the restaurant is so understaffed that eating a simple meal can take literally hours: the option is to eat elswhere but there is nothing nearby. The rooms are OK but the beds are uncomfortable: thin mattresses with small sheets that don't stay tucked in. Checking out at (normal) busy times can be very slow - again due to understaffing. It tries to position itself as a business hotel but fills up rooms with tour parties so breakfast can be a struggle. At euro 19 that is also a profound gastronomic disappointment: e.g. weak orange juice from concentrate. You would need a good reason to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!! Not so good location.”
Reviews.Author: xxLaniexx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel the first time I ever went to Amsterdam. It was very very cheap and when arriving in the hotel we could not believe what we got for our money! The lobby was beautiful & very modern, the actual building is also very modern looking too. The lady on reception was lovely and really helpfull she gave us maps and advised on the best travel services in and out of central Amsterdam. The room itself was very clean, plush and comfortable! I couldn't really ask more from a hotel room really. The bed is still to this date the comfiest I've ever slept on!! All the fittings were of a really high quality. The hotel itself is around a 15 mins tram ride away from central Amsterdam which was a little annoying but for the price you can't really complain. There are no shops around really so if you need anything for your room make sure you stock up when you go into Amsterdam. If I were to visit Amsterdam on a serious budget again I would stay in this hotel in a flash! If you are like me and can't stay in b&b's with shared bathrooms etc.. then this is the best you will get for your money on a budget! However if you have more money to play with Iw ould suggest staying central.

Reviews.Title: “Started out as a very neat hotel, and then lost its charm because of "wear and tear"”
Reviews.Author: Alex L
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed here the hotel was just open a few months or so. Back then (early 2006) hotel rooms with multimedia LCD TV's were still quite rare, so that impressed. Also, the decoration of the rooms was very nice, especially the wooden floors. Another big plus was plain free wireless...all very unusual. After that first time I stayed a dozen times or so until about a year ago. Hotel rooms have been suffering a lot from wear and tear, broken things that do not get fixed, TV problems, problems with water running of in bath tubs and sinks and such. The management should really keep an eye on that and everything would be much better. I stopped using the hotel for these reasons, but also because the beds really provide poor sleeping quality...the pillows can hardly be called pillows, and you can hardly speak of a mattress. Most chain hotels in and around Amsterdam (Accor, Holiday Inn, for example) are better than Artemis today. 5 years ago it would be the other way around.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation on good price”
Reviews.Author: borbalas
Reviews.Content: Hotel ARTemis (hence the name) has a really impressive hall full of modern art pieces. Have a nice strolling around. Looking at the choices on a price around 70 EUR/ night in Amsterdam, this hotel was really worth it. The building and the rooms are brand new and clean. The bathroom has no hair dryer which was quite unusual but if you know in advance (as I read in one of the reviews) it is not a big problem. The bed is a bit too soft for my taste but still fine. The location is quite out of the center so only choose this hotel if you don't mind this and walking approx 10 min to the public transport. On the other hand within that 10 min. walking distance you have 3 choices and even can use a night bus (taxi prices are rather high). It takes 20-30 min to get to the center by bus/metro, but we really enjoyed getting some impression about suburb part as well. Also there is a direct bus from the airport with a stop quite close to the hotel. The hotel is located in an office park so rather plan to do shopping and eating in the center, you won't find anything really around. Note that there are more than one transport companies in Amsterdam, however we had our 2 days pas, we had to still buy a ticket on the bus leaving from just behind the corner. The staff was still ok, did answer all our questions, however rather in a hurry (there was no one else waiting?!) sometimes had difficulties to absorb all the information in such a speed and would have expected them to notify us about the public transport situation so we can avoid surprises. Overall I would recommend the place

Reviews.Title: “Near to the airport but in lonely area”
Reviews.Author: RajeshRathi
Reviews.Content: The rooms and the internet facility is good but the food quality and service levels are not up to the mark. The gym facility is not that of high standard. Checking out proccess sometimes is very time consuming as they have too many tourists. A very good location for art lovers.

Reviews.Title: “pieceful sleep but beware of your personal belongings well”
Reviews.Author: semrahosgor
Reviews.Content: I was together with my friend in Amsterdam for two days in November. We stayed two nights at Artemis Hotel. It's 20-25 minutes away from the city centre. The lobby area is wide and decorated at artdeco style. The rooms are comfortable and has nice details, like ironing, cofee machine etc. The breakfast is open buffet and the food is good but unfotunately you should not leave your personal belongings unattached because of theft. One of our friends' bag was stolen for the first day. Unfortunately there was no camera and the bag was not found. The person had her passport in it and hardly travelled back. Next day there was another theft at the breakfast lounge and nothing was found.the hotel itself is new and nice but it is not safe.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel. But not very good location and staff”
Reviews.Author: EstebanBelgrado
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel because all my favorite hotels in Amsterdam were booked. It was fairly close to my office so I said - let's give it a try. Location was in deed relatively close to my office but very far away from everything else. If you are a tourist in Amsterdam avoid this place. Hotel itself looks good. Nice design, quite new. Staff is not very friendly and I would say not on a top level in general. It can be quite busy on reception desk but there is only 2 persons there and one sometimes goes to the back, so only one guy handles 10 people. I had lunch in a restaurant. Selection was very poor but what I took was OK. Way to expensive for this level of the hotel - I have to say. Wireless internet is free but it didn't worked in my room on the first day. Tomorrow they sent a guy who did something and fixed it a little bit. Signal was still not perfect but I managed to work (send e-mails, check some basic web sites). There is a small gym in a hotel with one bench, couple of dumbbells and 4 cardio machines. All in all - if you don't have too many other options it is not such a bad hotel. But there is no any reasons for me to go back there. Unless I have to if other hotels are fully booked. Best thing about this hotel is that you can reach airport in 10 minutes. For early morning flights that means a lot of extra sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Decent price, not city centre but still easy to get to”
Reviews.Author: philstephenrichards
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good choice for travellers who are looking for comfort at a decent price, although you'll need to book well in advance to secure a bargain. It's well-connected for public transport into the centre of Amsterdam, and is also easily accessible directly from the airport. Tram line 2 takes approx. 30 minutes to get to the city centre from the nearest tram stop (Louwesweg). There's an easy pedestrian route from the tram stop which isn't plain from online maps; it would be useful if the hotel had this on their website. It's in a business park, so most of the weekday custom is business travellers and seminars. Breakfast is not included in the room rate and is expensive at approx. â‚¬20 a head, so if you're trying to keep the budget down, be prepared to eat out for breakfast (and note that there are no cafÃ©s nearby; we generally had breakfast in the city centre). Be aware there's also a tourist tax of approx. â‚¬5 a day which isn't included in the booking, and you'll be asked to pay this for the whole stay when you check in. Rooms are neat, nicely designed, comfortable, and provide all the facilities you'd expect from a 4-star hotel. The double bed was sizeable and extremely comfortable. Overall, it's welcoming without being cosy (so perhaps not right for that plush, romantic weekend away) but it's a long way from the functionality you'd get from an Etap or a Travelodge. We did have some problems, however. We arrived at 12:45pm; too early for the 2pm check in and had to wait; we were offered a luggage storage facility but chose to wait. The staff were efficient but initially a little brusque. When we got to the room, we discovered that the smoking room we'd requested was not given. We phoned reception and were told very sharply that it was a booking request, not guaranteed (which, if true, was not made clear anywhere when we booked). The receptionist went on to tell us we'd be fined if we smoked in the non-smoking room - no apologies or explanations were given. We were not pleased with their attitude. We went downstairs to deal with the matter in person and the desk staff were much more helpful, apologising and offering to give us a room exchange when one became available, which would be the next morning. The next day, we packed and were given cards for a new room which, when we tried to access, turned out to be already occupied! We returned to reception and the (now mortified) receptionist gave us a new room, which was empty, and everything else during our stay was smooth.

Reviews.Title: “that was not what we have expected”
Reviews.Author: LvCr
Reviews.Content: The hotel was too far away from the centre and the tramstation too. We payed for 1 night 89Euros instead of 320Euros. The room we stayed in was definately not worth the 320Euros (I cannnot imagine that someone pays so much money for such a basic hotelroom). Also I would like to mention that the mattress and the pillows were not comfy. Then, Check-out is at 12:00h and 2 hours before the cleaners rang at our door and tried to open it, eventhough they knew someone was in the hotelrooom.... The service was okay. All in all, Amsterdam is an amazing city but when we go back next year we surely won't stay again at the Artemis Dutch Design Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but too far from city center”
Reviews.Author: rosannar
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very nice, rooms big and comfortable, bathrooms with very good ammenities which help when you are traveling with a carryon and not so much with you, breakfast was very good, only downside is that the hotel is completely outside of the city, is very far to say the least, we had a rented car and it was better to use that than the tram since we would have had to walk a lot to take the tram to go to the city center, they charge for parking but is worth it, we took our car and just found parking in amsterdam , which can be tricky so be careful where you park, make sure you find the machine to pay for the parking space, if breakfast is not included in your rate, then is worth paying it because there is nothing around there just offices and wasting time in the city center is not advisable if you are taking tours, but overall the hotel is very nice and if you dont mind the walk, then the tram will put you in the city center in 20 minutes, since a taxi will charge you 20-25 euros, pillows were uncomfortable, too soft, when I requested additional ones, we were told that they ordered new ones but had not arrived yet, so I ended up with neck pains because of it, I wont stay here again if I have another choice

Reviews.Title: “For the price range, you expect slightly more service”
Reviews.Author: Kwien_Z
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, and it has a very nice breakfast buffet, but it is quite far from the city center (on foot). The room is spacious and tidy, and thank god on a hard wooden floor instead of on carpet. The bathroom is large and clean. Upon arrival in the room, tv didn't work. Called the front desk who gave us the classic switch on switch off suggestion, as if we hadn't tried that one yet... Check out desk cannot deal with stress as they were extremely unfriendly and bossy when dealing with supposed minibar charges.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Taylor1979
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel located in a quiet commercial area of Amsterdam. Rooms are clean and very new. This hotel caters to more of a business crowd however was very nice for our visit to Amsterdam. It is a 10 min walk to the street tram that will take you into the entertainment district. The tram takes approx 20 mins. Some may see this as a downside however we found the tram to be a nice way to see Amsterdam while commuting as opposed to being in an underground line. Only downside to the hotel is that it is not located in the entertainment district.

Reviews.Title: “all business and OK”
Reviews.Author: jumpinhorsedad
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during IBC tradeshow and conference when the hotel was completely full so perhaps hard to comment fairly. the hotel is good for business. it is in an industrial park full of IBM, PWC, atradius etc. it is close to the airport and close to the RAI (comparatively) My harshest complaint is the wifi did NOT work at all when the hotel is full. we went with 6 staff, staying on various floors and they all said the same. typical breakfast spread this star hotel and restaurant food was OK. hospitality was thin. you will have an ok stay if you must go here and perhaps the location convenience out weighs any troubles.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Gloria Y
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel. The room was neat and tidy, and the bed was comfortable. However, the wi-fi at the room was not good. I had problems of having Internet access throughout the three days. Quite a frustration! Various designers' items were displayed in the lobby. Bar and restaurant area looked nice. Staff at the reception counter were friendly and helpful. However, a kitchen staff was not friendly when I asked where the fitness room was. The hotel's location is quite far away from downtown; it takes 25-30 minutes by tram, and then you have to walk at least 10 minutes from the tram station back to the hotel. It is better to have a car if you choose this hotel, though you have to pay parking fee. Overall, not a bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average and in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: Living_in_Hotels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not as great as its website: - Receptionist are nice and helpful, no problem here. - Rooms are average. The sink was broken and blocked. Shower was also blocked so I was having a unwanted foot bath every morning. Bed sheets are not large enough so in the morning you find yourself directly on the mattress and I discovered not very nice stains on mine. I didn't sleep well. - Breakfast is ok. - Restaurant is ok but service is very slow. - Location is awful, really in the middle of nowhere in the industrial zone and you have to walk a long way to the public transport. Expect around 25â‚¬ of taxi to go to the center. So in conclusion, this hotel is good for business traveller who need to go to the neighbour companies or for meetings where isolation from the world is needed. Maybe drivers that need to have a night stop in Amsterdam could find it useful as it is near the motorway.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: xxamtxx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great retreat from the busy streets of amsterdam very cosmopolitan spotlessly clean, 5 to 10 minute walk to tram stop out the back of the hotel which only cost us 19 euro for unlimited travel for the whole four days of our stay a great base if you dont mind the walk.

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel with excellent bed rooms”
Reviews.Author: yesaurabh
Reviews.Content: very fresh and contemporary in style. stayed in Executive rooms which was spacious and very comfortable. its 15 mins by taxi to central station. overall the hotel is excellent value for money. would recommend this hotel strongly to others

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: Phillis_d_sa
Reviews.Content: The Artemis is essentially a business hotel, in an out of town business park. The hotel rooms are modern and have everything you would expect from a 4 star hotel. The trip into town consisted of an under 10 min walk to the tram and then the number 2 tram for 20-25 min. It wasn't an arduous journey, but it would take a big chunk of our your day to return to the hotel to change before going out at night etc. Personally it didnt bother me that much because I stayed out all day and into the late evening and didnt need to return to the hotel. I believe from central station a taxi cost around 25euros late at night to get back to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Boulderbabs
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here as a last minute arrangement. we spent 6 days here and had no issues with the hotel's accommadations or the staff. we did not eat at the hotel .it seems to have a niche for the businses traveler ( free wifi) and groups. it is not centrally located but has great public transportation options ( tram 2) to the central city. it was a good 10 minute walk to the tram stop which was flat easy walking and i found a nice way to begin and end the days. it is in a very quiet business park ,south west of town near the airport. it is not the hotel for the young who want to be near easy access and walking distance of central city or restaurants. we spent our days in the city , ate dinnner , before going back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet but poor location”
Reviews.Author: Mac4SouthWales
Reviews.Content: Have stayed many times over past years for business. Hotel itself is clean and rooms are comfortable and quiet. Room service good though choice limited. Restaurant serves good food but service is slow and portions not large for the price. If you have a large tour party staying then you will have a wait for your food 1 hour plus. An empty restaurant last week took 20-30 minutes for main course, I have waited 1 to 1.5 hours in the past. City centre is around a 5-10 minute walk to the tram (No.2), the tram ride is around 15 minutes, â‚¬ 2.60 each way. Location is what lets this hotel down, I would not recommend if you are looking to be close to the city. It is close to the airport though, 195 bus takes around 10 minutes, again â‚¬2.60

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: honestopinions11
Reviews.Content: me and my friend went for a few days for a short get away. the staff in the hotel were very welcoming, beware there is a tax to pay when you first arrive for visiting but for our 3 night stay it worked out less then ten euro. our room was pristine, double bed was huge, bathroom was immaculate. provided iron and ironing board, floor heating in the bathroom, safe and TV. we never tried out the room service, or the restaurant we ate out instead. although not set in the heart of the city, it was not far to travel. the bus stop is right outside the hotel, you get the 145 into leidseplein which takes roughly twenty minutes, but is reasonably priced, about 2-3 euro. the staff at the hotel are very helpful though, they give you maps and bus or tram routes. if you need directions to certain places they are more then willing to tell you the routes and stops to get off. leidseplein is pretty cetral to the rest of amsterdam there is also a lot of restaurants or fast food places available here, from there we usually got day tram cards for about 8 euro, remember to tap on and as you get off the tram. the people within the shops are very willing to help though with directions and how to use the tram cards. there is also a night bus that operates to the hotel which the staff tell you about, so there is always a way back there, its not in the middle of nowhere as some of these reviews may have you believe! all in all this hotel was exactly what we needed, somewhere comfortable, clean and homely for a great nights sleep. we went to amsterdam to explore the city rather than sit in the hotel all day, even so the hotel was so pleasant i wouldnt mind staying in there! food was a bit pricey for me and my friend though. i would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting amsterdam. it was well worth the money and more. oh there is also a shop availble for grocery shopping or snacks within a 10 minute walk from the hotel staff will also give directions to that!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: cdickson20
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel between Christmas and New Year. The hotel itself was pretty nice, the rooms were fairly modern, and kept relatively clean. It;s positioning in relation to the city is somewhat to be desired, but we were well aware of this when we decided to stay there. It took around 10 minutes to walk from the hotel to the tram stop and a further 15-20 mins from the tram stop to the city centre. All in all it was a pretty good stay considering the price we paid. I do feel this hotel would be more suited to the business traveller given it is in the centre of a business park, however for the budget traveller who appreciates a modern room and facilities, it was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel on a Business Expense Account ONLY”
Reviews.Author: GayNaturistTraveler
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 4-night stay at the Artemis -- chosen purely because of it's proximity to the company I was visiting on business. The hotel is VERY nice -- the design is contemporary, high-style Dutch interior design -- the staff was friendly and my guest room was well appointed, Like others have said, the hotel is on the outskirts of Amsterdam. To get into the heart of the city requires a 10-minute walk to the #2 tram stop, then a 30-minute ride to Leideseplein (the main tourist entertainment area). The trams are clean, safe, cheap and reliable. So while it's not an ideal location for a pure tourist, it's not an unbearable journey for those visiting on business -- and that's a good thing, because there is NOTHING -- absolutely NOTHING â€” close to the hotel ... no shops, restaurants, coffeeshops, cafes ... NOTHING. So, if you want to have dinner, have a drink or catch a buzz (you ARE in Amsterdam after all) you will have to travel. It's true that the hotel has a restaurant -- but the food is rather mediocre and EXHORBITANTLY expensive. A hamburger and potato chips were 21 Euro and breakfast was 19.50 Euro. At the current exchange rate, that's just under $30 for breakfast or a burger. Truly ABSURD -- but you're captive and they know it! A few rather odd things about the hotel: 1) There is no clock in the room. Yes, the telephone display shows the time and so does the TV if you turn it on, but lying in bed there's no way to know what time it is. 2) If you want a wake up call, you can set your tv to come on at the appointed time BUT it just turns on and shows a screen that says it's time to get up -- but there's NO SOUND element, so how it's supposed to wake you up is baffling. Call the front desk and they will wake you up. 3) There's an ice machine on each floor BUT there's no ice bucket in your room, so you have to take your little water glass to the ice machine every time you need a few more cubes. A few rather nice things about the hotel: 1) The bathroom floor is heated -- unexpected to say the least. 2) Free internet that was fast and had great signal strength. 3) A beautiful terrace overlooking a reflecting pool filled with lily pads right next to a canal. 4) A lovely, serene park less than a 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Bottom line, when I'm there on business working with a client in the vicinity, I'll stay there -- but if you're there to visit Amsterdam and enjoy all that it has to offer, the Artemis should NOT be on your list of suitable hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent stay at the Dutch Design Artemis”
Reviews.Author: KenSmith
Reviews.Content: This is a really excellent hotel â€“ it is modern, the rooms are kept spotlessly clean and the staff are extremely helpful and courteous. As others have commented the reception staff go to great lengths to assist in any way. Breakfast is well worth having - with hot and cold food available at the buffet. We were offered a discount if we booked it for each day we were staying and paid â‚¬14 each per day. We travelled to the hotel from the airport on 195 bus (â‚¬2.60 unless you buy a chip-card at the airport â€“ see below) to the IBM stop â€“ you canâ€™t miss the big white IBM building. Cross the road and walk a few meters to the right take the road left between the Atradius and a second IBM building. At the first junction you will see the hotel on the right. It is a very short walk. The hotel website makes it clear that it is out of town between Schiphol and the city centre - so I do not understand why some people have complained about that. It is in a very pleasant business area. If you donâ€™t mind a 20 minute walk you can reach several places to eat and find two large supermarkets. We ate at one of the two Chinese Restaurants but there was Thai and a European well as some pizza places and cafes. We found the beds comfortable and spent five peaceful nights. TV has BBC 1, 2 and World as well as several european station. The TV has clear reception. Dutch public transport is very good and the best value is got by buying a GVB ticket. There are 24-hour (â‚¬7), 48 (â‚¬11.50), 72 (â‚¬15.50), 96 (â‚¬19.50), 120 (â‚¬24), 144 (â‚¬27.50) and 168 (â‚¬30) OV-chipcards which they allow unlimited travel on all trams, GVB buses, metros and night buses. Remember to swipe our chip-card in and out. We found that the number 2 tram was the best bet to get into the city - even though it takes about 10 minutes to get to the stop (Louwesweg) because it runs very frequently and goes all the way to Centraal Station. You can also use all of the trams in the City. The nearest bus stop is for the 145 bus - just at the rear of the hotel but it served by the rival company Connexxion and it does not accept the GVB card. We really enjoyed our stay, couldnâ€™t fault the hotel and would recommend it if you do not want to stay in the centre of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Cold and uninviting. Not for leisure”
Reviews.Author: deekyKent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artemis for 3 nights but definitely won't stay again. It's very far from anywhere and tucked away between a business estate and a housing estate. The rooms are nice enough but it would really be nice if whoever allocates them would remember that a married couple would prefer a double bed rather than 2 single beds. It's becoming the oldest trick in the book to get more revenue from room 'upgrades' so stop doing it. Also...wooden panelling in the rooms and a purple plastic childs chair?? We only had one drink at the bar in all the time we were in Amsterdam because there is simply no choice but Heineken and some drink i had never heard of and the hotel has a very 'cold' feeling to it. There is no place to sit and relax inside the hotel at all and for some strange reason they have let someone loose with a few planks of wood and a hand saw!!....I mean, what the hell was the person thinking when they decided to build a wooden wall around a single chair in the middle of the lobby?....Planks of wood had also been sawn up and nailed together to make what i can only describe as 'jengo gone wrong' and the seating area inside looks like a school canteen. You're a hotel and not an art gallery so sack the person who commisioned the mad chippy, stop trying to be all artistic, and concentrate on giving your customers a comfortable stay. We won't be going back to the Artemis for 2 main reasons; It's too far from anywhere - unless you work at IBM, and the boarding area at the airport has more charm.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel if you read the book thats left in the room for you you'll be fine”
Reviews.Author: happydays186460
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel which has everything you need, clean and tidy. With reguards to coming from the airport buy a gvb ticket in the airport their prices are really cheap and can be used on all buses or trams. Catch the 195 bus and this will take you to the bus stop around the corner of the hotel, its the one opposite the ibm building. For a 3 day pass it was 19.50 euros and this is unlimited use. There is a bustop around the trams are a ten minute walk away, catch the number 2 tram into town and back its soon easy. I would recommend this hotel its fab for the price and around about 15 minutes from town. Make sure you dont pull anything out of the minibar as they have sensors on them and will charge you for them and there are extra pillows there in the cupboards if you look. All i can say it was fab free hairdryer, trousers press, ironing board, iron and free tea and coffee. Like i say if you read the book thats left for you you will know everything. You can also purchase gvb tickets from reception.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly managed, staff left to pick up the pieces...”
Reviews.Author: ColonelDr
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Artemis as part of a post-wedding celebratory holiday in Amsterdam, after it was recommended by some of the party who had stayed there before. I'll start with the positives: The hotel looks lovely, is clean and well furbished and the desk staff did what they could to help. There is free wireless internet also. The negatives: The hotel is so far out from the activity centres of Amsterdam (Leidseplein and Dam Square) that it takes a 10-15 minute walk followed by a 25-30 minute tram ride to get there. It is very close to the airport though. Equally the hotel had clearly over booked. Even though we had booked two months in advance, when we arrived we were told to wait while they found us rooms (and the desk staff told us that some people would have to be sent to another hotel as we were having their rooms). People who ordered twins got doubles, people who ordered doubles got singles, the whole thing was a nightmare. One person then had a member of staff cancel his room key and walk into his room after 24 hours as she thought he had been moved. A poor show really. Finally the rooms looked great, but the beds were uncomfortably soft, and only came with one pillow each which was tiny and thin so sleep wasn't really possible I really wanted to love The Artemis, and had heard good things, but I won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't think a hotel could be so perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Mattturner45
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend recently took a trip to Amsterdam, being students we set out looking for a good hotel at an even better price and the Artemis hotel did not disappoint at Â£55 per night for a 4* hotel. Once we booked the hotel in January this year we read a few reviews that did not show the Artemis in a good light, this was a bit disconcerting as we didn't know what to expect, we read many reviews, and the main qualm that people had was that it was so far from the centre of Amsterdam and the transport links were poor. Although the hotel is outside the centre of Amsterdam in the business district i dispute the comments made about the transport links, Amsterdam has one of the bus, tram and train services i have ever experienced, it was a few minutes walk from the hotel to the nearest tram station, Louwesweg, and then 10 minutes on the tram number 2 to the main entertainment are Leidseplien and a further 5 minutes to Centraal station. The airport was also close to he the hotel and it cost â‚¬25 to get to the hotel which was cheaper than the hotel shuttle between to two of us, alternatively there is a bus you can catch which is the 195, we took the bus back to the airport on our last day as we had purchased a 72 hour OV-Chipkaart from the hotel for â‚¬15.50 which allowed for us to have unlimited travel over that 72 hours which was great for the tram and bus links to the main entertainment areas in Amsterdam. The hotel was warm and welcoming with very helpful, friendly and knowledgeable staff who spoke pretty much fluent English. We didn't try the hotel restaurant but we heard that the food was absolutely fantastic which i can believe due to the quality of the hotel. The Artemis was well furnished and we had everything that we needed for out trip. All of the rooms at the hotel are well furnished well and extremely comfy, and all include a guide to the room, hotel and Amsterdam. Problems with the hotel: During our stay we only had one problem, which was that the minibar in the room is automated, which i did not realise so as soon as anything is taken out it adds it to the bill, i say this was a problem but as we did not consume anything we picked up we did not get charged we just had to explain to reception and they removed it from the bill. (it says that the minibar is automated on the actual fridge, i just didn't read that) Overall i would most defiantly recommend The Dutch Design Artemis Hotel, in fact we are already talking about going back over to Amsterdam for new year (2 days after our return) and will defiantly be staying in this hotel. I hope you have found this review useful Matt Turner (Date of stay 23rd Feb 2011 - 25th Feb 2011)

Reviews.Title: “what a trip”
Reviews.Author: th0mash1ll
Reviews.Content: This hotel was seriously one of the best i had stayed in. Check in said 2pm onwards but we arrived at 10am and our room was ready. It was very clean and the size of the room was spacy. The bathroom facilities were great with a powerful shower. The hotel was only about a 5 min walk from the tram stop from which you get the number 2 tram to leibseplein (the entertainment district) for all the bars, restaurants and coffeeshops. Taxis were expensive but if you get an ov card for public transport (cost depends on the length of card, 1 hour, a day 3 days etc) then you can get any bus, tram or metro (not sure about trains) and swipe in when you get on and off when you get off. Trams are the best way to get round. A deffinate must stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but transport from Schiphol a problem”
Reviews.Author: Buspassjock
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this hotel as it was immaculate and the staff were excellent. The breakfast buffet was one of the best I have had and there were some good snacks at the bar if you did not want a full meal in the restaurant. My one problem arose when trying to get there from Schiphol airport. We had intended using the service bus which we knew costs about Euro 2.50 but after waiting for half an hour in sub zero temperatures we were informed that the bus was delayed by another half hour. We decided to opt for a taxi but the driver was apparantly not interested and directed us to the Shuttle Bus Service. This service is independent of any of the hotels and charges a flat Euro 15.50 rate so I landed up paying Euro 31 for a five minute ride. Many of the hotels in the area have combined to provide a free bus shuttle so I would suggest Artimis follow suit. Incidentally if a taxi is willing to take you it will cost about Euro 25.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: chrisnfamliy
Reviews.Content: Very very nice room, very clean and had friendly staff. booked a double and received a nice size room. very big, clean and comfortable bed as well as bath room looked almost brand new. Only problem is as we was visiting for pleasure. It is very far from city centre. If drove or have hired a vehicle this place is ideal. Not much in the gym and no swimmingpool but very nice resturant, bit pricey mind but all roundvery nice.

Reviews.Title: “better and cheaper hotels in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: megal97
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel , clean , comfortable and near to Airport with a good tram link to city centre. however a bit too far from Amsterdam centre for a short city break. Breakfast was good with excellent choice in a relaxed environment. hotel facilities are more geared to business travelers and airport stopovers. More convenient and friendly hotels can be found in Amsterdam city centre .

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Ambivalent about the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: zmeyer
Reviews.Content: Was here on business with IBM, so the location was dictated by that, and it is very convenient for IBM, no for sightseeing. The room was excellent, quite large by European standards and the bathroom was very nice and modern. Free wifi - always a plus. Breakfast has two options - a buffet and a "grab n go" at half the price which is more than adequate. This hotels weak spot is the reataurant. The service is inattentive and the kitchen appears to be unable to deal with a busy dining room. The food itself was inconsistent, ranging from excellent on one evening, to appalling on another as was the service, ranging from excellent and attentive one evening to impossible on another. All in all, good value for money, but it would make sense to eat elsewhere if one has the time and the patience to go to the city

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Patrick1985Eire
Reviews.Content: So, Where do I begin? We went on a city break to Amsterdam last year - which is an amazing city! My friends decided to book a cheap hotel and we found this one to be as cheap as they got for hotels. It turned out to be a huge mistake to book this hotel. We landed in Schippol airport in Amsterdam and got a cab to the hotel (which was advertised as being close to the airport). The Taxi fare was an absolute fortune for a 20 minute drive but luckily we could manage as we split it 5 ways. The hotel itself is located MILES outside of Amsterdam City center. It is located near many industries and commercial center's such as IBM and the hotel is geared towards business people. Inside, the hotel has large modern artistic displays everywhere and I found it cool and funky to look at. The rooms had a fairly basic television in them with a basic bath tub and shower combo. The beds were pretty comfortable and overall I was happy with the room. Now for the bad parts: Firstly, we were told that there was a residents bar in the hotel. Or "24 hour bar" as it was advertised on its website - this was false and the bar was NEVER open in the four days we spent there. Then there was the staff - VERY RUDE.Although we were initially greeted by a nice receptionist our general opinion of the staff was not at all good. I recall one waiter barking at me for taking a glass of orange juice from the breakfast buffet table as "breakfast stopped five minutes ago" and I was then told to "get lost" - as if I committed a personal offense against this man. Other staff members were rude to my friends also and we all seemed to have a bad story about the staff members. The worst, absolute worst thing about this hotel has to be the distance it is from Amsterdam center.. To get to Amsterdam center you can A) get a very expensive taxi or B) get the bus/tram (I recommend getting the bus as its much faster). You will find yourself having to walk along a deserted street for ten minutes to get to the bus/tram stop. Then your waiting another ten minutes for one to show up and then you might be stuck on the bus/tram for 25 minutes while you are dragged all over the city before you get to central Amsterdam. This for the four days I spent cost a lot of money. Overall: Dont come here. Im a pretty easy person to please but I just did not like this place. Rude staff, no bar, much too far away from the city center. wasting money on cabs and transport etc..

Reviews.Title: “nice trendy hotel outside of Amerdam”
Reviews.Author: meisterQB
Reviews.Content: the dutch design hotel is a nice location to stay at. The room are really good looking and comfortable. Our ling size bed was soft and I'd a good sleep. It is locted a little outside of Amsterdam and the next tram station is a 10 minute walk away. The ride downtown takes about 30 minutes and costs â‚¬2.60 for one way. A parking option is the hotel own parking garage, but there is a public parking lot just 100m away where you can park for free, which is very seldom in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “insistent room check wakes you up every morning!”
Reviews.Author: clementine_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at this hotel with my boyfriend and our first impression was fine. Despite the fact that the hotel is far away from the city centre, bus and tram connections are available. The worst thing about the hotel was the rude room service! Every morning the room service knocked our door and even entered the room at 10 am, and they kept coming in every 15 minutes! Every morning we had trouble with the room service and a lady who was also knocking the door to check the room. We were supposed to be on holiday but they didn't allow us to take a rest because of their insistent ambition for room check in the morning, and there was not any sign in the room to hang on the door in order to stop them entering the room.

Reviews.Title: “wrong room......”
Reviews.Author: namsan
Reviews.Content: hotel fully booked, and only had a single sofa bed room left for two people, despite booking a double...... poor service...... avoid!!

Reviews.Title: “Very very average at best”
Reviews.Author: Saskia_Rosenthal
Reviews.Content: Despite having booked a double, I got a twin. When I called reception, they gave me a triple, or a double with a field bed in the room. Room is fine but nothing special. Only black tea, no herbal. No milk. The breakfast was said to be â‚¬15 at reception, however I was told to pay â‚¬19 at the resto. The promotion apparently was only when you booked brekkie through reception. Ridiculous. Even â‚¬15 would have been expensive for a very average selection and cold coffee from a machine. Won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't really recommend this hotel to travellers other than business people.”
Reviews.Author: sidesix
Reviews.Content: The reason I wouldn't recommend this hotel to non-business visitors? Well my partner and I spent a weekend as part of our anniversary. We were put up in a twin room because they had no doubles left, even though a request was made 3 months ago when I booked the room. So it was two single beds we had to push together ourselves. The room itself is very nice. The view, not so nice. The bathroom is beautiful, spacious, clean with a lovely shower and all the usual ammenities. The room has a safe & free wifi, TV with a range of European Channels, Coffee & Tea with a kettle, and an Iron. The big let down on the room is the beds... They are not very good at all. Very old mattresses make for an awkward sleep, they dip in the middle from the years of other sleepers. The pillows are as flat as pancakes. The hotel is very expensive to eat at too. E19 euro for BREAKFAST?! ... I suggest taking the nearby tram 2 stops west (away from the city) there are two decent supermarkets and a few places to get food. Travel to the city is about 40-odd minutes by the tram. The tram is a 5min walk away if you cut through the back streets. There is a bus that stops right near the hotel straight to the airport, and on a Sunday-took us 15/20minutes. Service, was... average, nothing spectacular. The hotel inside is nice, its kept well, its kept clean. If you're a couple wanting a romantic break, its probably not for you. If you're on a budget, and 19 euros for breakfast is out of your reach, its also probably not for you; if you want a comfortable bed, its not for you; but if your company is paying and you couldn't care less about the sleep quality-I well recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TommyTwoShoes
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located for business purposes. The hotel was good: rooms and bathrooms were very clean and breakfast and dinner were enjoyable. The reception could do with some more staff for check-in/-out and we unfortunately had a waiter apparently working his first day who proceeded to pour out our wine to the adjacent table! We were recompensed with a free bottle of wine to make up for it! Breakfast was a little chaotic - the first day I was not charged for breakfast and the second day I was requested to fill out a form for breakfast. The hotel rooms all have the ubiquitous notice saying that we should save water and washing powder and use our towels again: I duly hung up my towels to be reused but they were changed anyway - what is the point of that? However, will definitely stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to business but terrible room and sleep quality”
Reviews.Author: kmalay
Reviews.Content: I was shocked to see the quality of bed and room. The AC was throwing dust and next day they did not even made the bed just covered it as it is with bed cover. Very basic Gym, bad food. Overall hotel design looks nice but devil is in details. avoid the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lush hotel, not so lush location”
Reviews.Author: thisiscooling
Reviews.Content: Hotel Artemis is a gorgeous hotel - the decor, rooms and restaurant are beautiful. The down sides of this hotel are that it is pricey (drinks at the bar were especially overpriced) and the location is very poor. Although the tram and train connections are a short walk away we found it inconvenient to go back to the hotel to freshen up before heading back out for dinner or drinks in the city.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but the time is showing”
Reviews.Author: indodutch
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, little away from the city but bus and tram are good connections direct to downtown there were tough arrive at 1 pm and got told 2 pm is check in time even 150 after waiting in lobby, thank lord free internet, see had to wait till 2 pm, why so hard the room is nice and the atmosphere of the hotel as alwasy with changng art exhibtions is nice the only downside the beds are showing there age and are getting soft and a "hole" in the middle where all the guests sleep, please upgrade your matresses and bring your smile back and it will be ok it was annoying at check in and check out that the front staff was doing three things at once, while only focus on one thing and do it right, also annoying to ask your credit card back after all a good stay but cna be better

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful design, if you like it modern, but in the middle of an office area”
Reviews.Author: Tjongo
Reviews.Content: Pros: Free wifi, and you don't have to bother about passwords. Fast as well. Very nice, modern design. Spaceous room with enough wardrobes. Nice bathroom. Cons: The location is only nice if you have business to the offices in the area, there is no atmosphere. However, there is a tram nearby and it's not very far to the city center. The bed was a little too soft for my liking. Breakfast expensive and definitively not worth it. Saw no coffee shop nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Hat nichts zu bieten auÃŸer der (schlechten) Lage”
Reviews.Author: breitler
Reviews.Content: Basically an interesting designer hotel located at the middle of nowhere outside of Amsterdam. Overpriced restaurant . The staff ist not really helpful and the breakfast quality is really a a bad joke for 19 Euros per person. If this hotel would not be that close to my company offices, I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for tourists!!! Don't bother unless...”
Reviews.Author: Tattoobear
Reviews.Content: Not for tourists!!! Don't bother unless your on business. I am in my room now and I am wondering what the hell I am doing here??? Awful location, you have to pay 25â‚¬ to get a cab to dam square. The staff don't seem to take an interest in your personal experience at this hotel. It's prices are through the roof and to be quite honest it's substandard on many levels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: swallis029
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone! My husband and i had never been to amsterdam before, we found a cheap deal on this hotel so decided to stay there. Id read the reviews and prepared myself for the worst. When we arrived at 12:30pm they checked us straight in, even had smoking rooms availible, which was great for us! the staff were so friendly. We then walked about 10mins to the nearest tram stop. the trams (number 2) come every 6mins so we were never waiting around. The journey was about 15-20mins into the city, but it was nice to see all the buildings and surroundings in amsterdam. The rooms were lovely,clean and modern, and all rooms are en-suite, which is alot better than some grotty shared bathrooms you'd get in the centre. We then jumped on the 195 bus to the airport which was cheap and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but only if you have business nearby”
Reviews.Author: jonorose
Reviews.Content: I just spent nearly a week in the Artemis Dutch Design Hotel in Amsterdam while attending a trade show at the RAI. First of all let me make it perfectly clear. This hotel is in the middle of nowhere. Its in the middle of a business park that is deserted after about 5pm. There are no shops nearby, there are no restaurants nearby. There is one bus which can take you to the center (your best option), and the nearest tram and metro stations are a good 10-15 minute walk. A taxi to the center will cost you 20-25 euros depending on traffic and time of day. This hotel should be considered ONLY if you are visiting one of the companies in the immediate vicinity, or if you have no other option. Having said all that, its actually a very nice hotel. It seems to be fairly new, its very modern and has a theme of featuring Dutch designers (hence the "Dutch Design Hotel" moniker). The rooms are quite spacey, nicely furnished, comfortable beds and spotlessly clean. There is free internet, breakfast has a good selection and the room service hamburger was OUTSTANDING. All in all, its a very nice 4 star hotel. Just heed my warning on the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reisende40
Reviews.Content: The rooms are lovely! This is a new and fresh hotel, great breakfast area, spacious meeting rooms and a relaxing garden area.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: DmitryStPetersburg
Reviews.Content: Hi All, I stayed at Artemis hotel with my wife. We knew in advance that it is not in the downtown but Booking.com gave us a good offer and we decided to stay there moreover, at the photos it looked nice enough and high tech. There are a couple of reasons I did not liked it and would NEVER reccomend it to anyone. My review all in all would say - if they put all the personnel away - they would earn more money. 1. The description how to reach the hotel was not written correctly. I was coming by car from Belgium and used their recommendations but it leaded me to the wrong direction. 2. The area around the hotel is ok, but there are just some office buidlding and that's it but as I wrote it was not a problem for us but it might be important for somebody. 3. We used a car to get itto the downtown and met no problems at all, but as I understand - metro station is quite far from the hotel and it is not nice enough to walk. 4. This item is number four, but I have had to make it first. Extremely BAD and TERRIBLE staff. 4.1 They were very rude when we came. They are very slow and there were a lot of people standing at the reception and I took my time to see how Artemis staff is doing their job. I saw a lot of European hotels but I NEVER met such an attitude even in Etap hotel. During my last years I staid all over the Europe and I know what is ok for the hotel reception but those people are absolutelyfar away from the service. 4.2. The kettle inside the room was dirty when we came. I visited the reception (not called them, but visited peronally!) and asked them to solve the problem. They promised me to replace the kettle. When we returned after 14 hours - the kettle was dirty!! Could you imagine that for 4* european hotel?! Me not. 4.3. The room is dirty, floor is very (!) dirty. Bathroom is dirty too. 4.4. The water temperature is constantly changing (does not depend on day or night time) 4.5.The show cabin is not closed properly so it is wet in the whole bathroom after you take a shower. So, all in all I would like to inform all of you to avoid this hotel if you want to be served and treated in the right way.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient if you are working nearby, otherwise why stay here”
Reviews.Author: HPK
Reviews.Content: The only reason to stay here is if you are working in one of the office buildings nearby. The Artemis is a nice enough hotel with clean comfortable rooms at a decent price but there is NOTHING around it except a few office buildings for high tech companies. The next time I go to Amsterdam I will stay in the city and take the #2 tram for the 15 minute ride out to this location for work. The closest stop is Louwesweg which is a 5 min walk from the hotel and nearby office buildings. As of Aug. 2010 the one way fare (payable on the tram) is 2.60 Euro. At least I'll have somewhere to go for dinner after work.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer care, staff that lie.”
Reviews.Author: Sim0nmc
Reviews.Content: We ordered a double room, they gave us a twin. The check in guy served a new check in first and then his colleague came. She said the double is an option as they are same price, but on website you clearly choose double or twin. I said she could upgrade us then, she said there were no rooms but she didn't check. We said we were leaving and she initially said she would charge us for parking...I was furious and she gave us a free ticket (obviously). Very unpleasant staff, horrible location, we stayed in NH Tropen which was lovely. Amsterdam was not full as horrible receptionist from Artemis shouted to us as we left. It was 15th August by the way...

Reviews.Title: “No complain procedure at hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sanjeev92
Reviews.Content: Severe safety issues at the main entrance revolving door. my 3 year old daughter arm was trapped. Very poor support from staff after the incident. No complaint procedure available. No medical help offered.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, bad location”
Reviews.Author: Andriesss
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a business area, without any tourist attraction. There are bus/tram connections that will take you to the city, but a cab drive is extremely expensive. It is recommened to have a car on hand. I stayed in the business room with a corner view, and it was very nice, excellent design, quiet and clean. The mini-bar and room service are expensive. The breakfast was ok with plenty of variations. Dinner on the other hand was basic, and there was little to no atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Design is efficient but cold and uninviting”
Reviews.Author: NLBatEBR
Reviews.Content: I was there with a group of colleagues for a conference and it is good for this purpose. Food is good, hotel is efficient. Staff were fine. Design touches are fun but don't add much. Rooms are a triumph of design over utility. Lighting is dreadful. No light near safe - try punching in numbers in the dark. Infuriating! Cold, hard floors. Minimal hanging space for two of us. Outlook is gloomy. And it's miles from Amsterdam. I'd use it if I was doing business next door and was there for one night. Otherwise no way.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: calorblind
Reviews.Content: i dealt with 3 diff staff, and not even one was polite. this is shocking. does the management know what is happening with their staff? they dont even look at you when they talk to you, one even sighed when i was asking questions, n looked as if he was annoyed. i was doing the check in, and the staff just threw the pen instead of giving it to me properly. i really hope someone will look into this. even the hostels which ive paid much less has better service than this

Reviews.Title: “Art and laughs”
Reviews.Author: litchy123
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, we were a bit worried about staying here. I think that the way the hotel had been slagged off in previous reviews was just a lack of understanding of Dutch culture. Yes, the distance from Dam central was a 20 minute tram journey but only a 5 minute walk to the tram stop (if you know the cheeky short cut). The staff were pleasant, the rooms spotless, the breakfast (pre paid) was plentiful and the maid service was daily. The room drinks facilities were a bit hit and miss(coffee not topped up) and the drinks at the bar slightly over priced, but that's hotel bars for you. Checking in and out was fast and any questions we had were answered with a smile. We actually found the tram journey in to Amsterdam central quite pleasant during the day but don't miss your return stop at night(scary). Tram no 2 in and out of the Dam and night bus back if you miss the midnight tram back is No 358 from central station. Thankyou to all the staff at Artemis for making our stay a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and funky hotel, but quite a way from the city centre..”
Reviews.Author: OvernightWill
Reviews.Content: A mate and I stayed here for the weekend when we went to the Awakenings techno festival. The hotel is minimalist in decor but very spacious, clean and refreshingly arty. In the main areas of the hotel, contemporary art and sculptures sit alongside bespoke pieces of modern furniture to give the place a unique atmosphere. The staff were all helpful and polite without being over the top. Our room was on the small side but nicely finished. As ever with hotels, a hi-fi wouldn't have gone amiss, but all other facilities were present and correct, including (very expensive) minibar - e.g. â‚¬5 for a small Toblerone. The total absence of complimentary biscuits was a little disappointing however, especially after a night taking full advantage of some of the city's more liberal policies. If you have some time to kill at the hotel, there's a peaceful, Ibiza-esque riverside terrace which is worth visiting if you want to chill out with a drink or two. Getting to the hotel by public transport from the airport is a struggle - figuring out the myriad bus stops at Schiphol is a task for the brave. Best to jump in a taxi if there's more than one of you - the blue, official looking shuttle bus is â‚¬15 per person, so with two persons plus a taxi will work out cheaper. The Artemis is good value and has bags of character. Although it's a good 4-5 miles from the centre of Amsterdam (â‚¬20-25 in a cab), you can get to the action easily by tram or bus during the day. It's in a business district so very quiet at night, but be warned - it's miles from any shops so make sure you load up on essentials at Albert Heijn on your way back from town. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “artemis- not again”
Reviews.Author: karynArmagh
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here before in 2008 we were looking forward to going back but how things have changed. We had booked a 'queensized bed' and were given a twin bedded room (on honeymoon) which was seriously in need of a deep clean. The beds had no undersheets and the first sheet didn't even fit and on the third day new ones were put on that were simply doubles folded in two. There were no spare pillows on hand (you had to ask at reception). The room had the same dust on the table and headboard that it had had all week and the room (444) was so small that if one person was at the dressing table the other had to climb over the bed to get past. Coming back from dinner one evening at 11.30 we went to the bar for a nightcap only to be told it was closed. Checking out was a long affair as there was one person on duty. This hotel is now over rated as a 4 star. It is in need of a real tidy up and with more attention to customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Frivolous Staff”
Reviews.Author: ttabb168
Reviews.Content: The staff is very very frivolous. He did not want to serve you. When we check in, he did not tell us the facility of the hotel and not provide the map of the city spontaneously for us. From his facial expression, I feel that I was belittled. I think that is a serious discrimination. Because he treat the people who live in Europe friendly. When he faced Asian people, like us, his attitude changes to bad. I strongly recommend Asian people do not go there. The facility is okay. The hotel is far from the central station and it takes 30 mins to arrive the central station by tram.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Pack Your Walking Boots!”
Reviews.Author: trickyd64
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel having read the reviews so were aware it wasn't near the city centre and that you would have to get a tram to get to all the attractions. Therefore, it didn't come as a surprise that a 15 min walk was required to get to the tram stop, but must admit by the end of the weekend we were getting tired of that walk, especially after a day of walking around Amsterdam. If you are prepared for that part of the trip and the 20/25 minute tram journey into town, I would recommend this hotel. When you check in, buy your tram ticket from reception (we got a 72 hour pass for 15.50 euros) there are lots of trams and run on time and are alot cheaper than getting taxis everywhere, which are very expensive in Amsterdam. The hotel was clean, service was fine (although there was a bit of a wait to check-in) and the area was very quiet, so all led to a very good nights sleep. My one complaint about the hotel was the standard of the bath towels, they were small, thin and rough. If the hotel management read this please think about changing them! Otherwise, a good stay and would recommend but be ready for that walk!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, lousy service”
Reviews.Author: ParisNigel
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and clean rooms, few design items, but not as much as you would expect. Service is bad. I was left in a queue for about ten minutes to check in, only one man was behind the desk, when i finally reached the reception, no apologies, nothing, Staff did not greet me, I was just asked my last name. As well, "please and thank you" seem to be unknown words to the staff. Reception and restaurant staff has an attitude, no smile and don't make you feel welcome at all, when you try to get the attention of a waiter it takes ages because they are usually talking to each other instead of taking care of guests. I had to call reception 3 times to ask an extra blanket but it was never delivered to my room, when i checked out I told reception, just sorry but no apologies. Ordered a bottle of water during dinner, which was never brought to my table. Nice product, but again, staff needs serious guest service training.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, BUT..”
Reviews.Author: Digerselz
Reviews.Content: 1) POSITION: Placed in a modern neighbourhood, without any tourist attraction, BUT with a good connection with the city-center. 2) ROOM: Excellent design, quiet and warm, BUT we dont loved the extra-modern stained-glass door of the bathroom. Good cleaning, BUT: We tried unsuccessull to open the "automatic-electronic" frigo-bar. At check-out, the informatic systhem of reception tried to charge in my check the fee for 2 bottles of wine and some chocolate. BE CAREFUL. 3) FOOD: Only for dinner, good quality, good portions, price not bad. Breakfast not checked. 4) FEE: Hotel cheap, if you considerate his high level. 5) CREW: Enough polite, discreet and helpful. 6) FACILITIES: The taxi to airport called by hotel was enough expensive. The hotel's brochure reported 25 euros, the real request made by the driver was 28 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Would go bk again tomorrow!”
Reviews.Author: xxNats86xx
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend away for valentines weekend and had the best time! Apart from me not finding out where the hotel was before we got there, id say we did pretty well in finding it! We got to the airport then took the train to the station, then went to the info desk and a lay helped us! She informed us that it would be cheaper buying a 3day travel card for the tram which only cost us 15euros which was such a bargin, as we used it so much!!! We used tram2 and got to Lowesweg then walked 5mins to the hotel! Reception was friendly and when we got to the room we were very impressed!! rooms are lovely and the breakfast was great!!! I would recommend going to the Bulldog bar and deffo eating in one of the steakhouses!! The amsterdam dungeons were AMAZING!! it was so scary in there i nearly cried!!lol. Would deffo go back xxx

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: danni_david
Reviews.Content: me and my husband have just got back from staying in the hotel artemis and loved it it was well presented, great rooms quiet location, good travel routes, was far from the city but a walk never done anyone any harm, next time we will be looking for something closer to the centre.over all great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great contemporary design”
Reviews.Author: LiliDam
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel if you had chosen to visit the city of Amsterdam. I mean it's a great place to sleep. It's not very close to the city center but not so far in the same time. 5 minutes by walk to go to the nearest tram stop. As soon as you are in the tram, you need around 15 minutes to be in the city center. It's better if you plan to spend all day out of the hotel ... leave in the morning and come back after the dinner if you don't want to spend too much time in the tram. The hotel is in the middle of a business area, with big corporate buildings. The hotel is great, brand new rooms with all the confort that you can expect. The bathroom was clean and the bed good. A very good place for a long week-end in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms, lousy service, far from town”
Reviews.Author: Aipotu
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, a nice size, and comfortable. Relatively quiet. Food in the restaurant is good, but service lousy -- understaffed, indifferent, slow as can be. Internet service is free but spotty. And there is absolutely nothing at all nearby other than office parks. No stores, no other hotels or restaurants. Business center is a noisy closet next to the bar -- with no phone. That just about captures the concept.

Reviews.Title: “Great Play to Stay”
Reviews.Author: kawaifan
Reviews.Content: After Belgium, we decided to explore the Netherlands. Stayed here for 7 days. We took the tram from Central Station to Lowesweg (it's after Aletta Jacobsplein.
