There is no stop at Aletta Jacobsplein) We had to walk a fair bit (with luggage and snow to contend with) so it was a bit annoying trying to look for the hotel. But once we found the hotel, it was all a breeze. Check-in by the reception staff (Geraldo) was fast. Breakfast was discounted as we were staying long. A request to move to another room was also done quickly. Other requests were also granted without any fuss. Note that we were simple travelers and we weren't wearing suits. However, we were dealing with the same reception staff each time so that probably made it easier. Tea/coffee-making facilities provided in the room along with ironing board (ironing board was a bit complicated to use though) Breakfast was filling although the variety didn't change. Hotel is a bit away but trams always work even if buses don't especially in winter when there's heavy snow. There's a bus stop at the back of the hotel for easy access to the city. Staff was great. When we requested for the shuttle to bring us to the airport, the reception supervisor suggested we take the taxi instead as it was cheaper (14.50EUR per person for shuttle vs 25EUR flat for taxi) . Also, the shuttle may not always come particularly in bad weather (think: snow). Alternatively, if one doesn't have a lot of luggage, one can just take the bus 195 for 1.50EUR. Check-out was also a breeze and was done by the same staff who checked us in. The only complaint if any was that the bed was a bit lumpy in the middle. Over-all, our stay there was fantastic and that was during the height of the "extreme weather condition."

Reviews.Title: “Modern, great service and comfortable rooms!”
Reviews.Author: margaretgumbrecht
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in the center of town, but very close to the tram stop which takes you to the center of Amsterdam in about 25 minutes. The service is great, very friendly staff. The room was very clean, modern and the bed very comfortable. The area is quiet and we had a great night sleep! I like the modern design of the hotel and they have a nice restaurant and bar as well. Great buffet breakfast (although a bit pricey). I will definitely stay there again. It is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “poor front desk and exorbitant costs in this out of town business hotel...”
Reviews.Author: runningchris
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a weekend - standard room was fine with decent bathroom (bath with shower over). BUT breakfast â‚¬17.50 per person (served in room) - and not great... poor coffee, some parties and bread. The front desk guys were rude - probably understaffed, prioritised phone calls over waiting customers. Made to feel like an inconvenience in their day. Finally, and not really a whinge but just to be aware, it's a business hotel for the local corporations (IBM/PwC etc) if you're a tourist visiting Amserdam then it's a good 10 minutes walk to public transport and then 30-40 minutes into Amsterdam Centraal. Overall we we're fine with the hotel for our weeken plans, but we'll look elsewhere for our return visits to the Dam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not so nice location”
Reviews.Author: jamais17
Reviews.Content: Friendly hotel staff and comfortable, modern rooms were offset by the hotel's location. It is in an industrial park on the outskirts of town. Access to the city centre is good, however. About a 10-15 minute walk to public transportation and then 15 minute ride. Hotel is designed in very modern style; offers great amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Good Price, and Great Breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: TiestoFan242
Reviews.Content: Great Loction to Airport, esp for early flight, only a few stops from the airport by bus, takes maybe 15 min or so. From bus stop by IBM building its only a couple min walk to hotel. Very nice inside, and service at desk is great. Will hold luggage till room is ready so can start out and see the city. Go back to main street where bus stop was at, and head left for a block or two and can pcik up tram that takes you into city center. Hotels rooms very nice, comfy bed, and amazing breakfast. There are places closer to night life in city for a lil more money but where the quality of hotel is way worse. This is worth it to stay outside of city center.

Reviews.Title: “Good but far from center”
Reviews.Author: Kordellya
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. The only disadvantage is that it was hard to find it.

Reviews.Title: “Art and comfort”
Reviews.Author: sunflowers4
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy our stay at this house!!! In my spare time I like to paint and iÂ´m really interested in art and design. So your this house was absolutely made for me!!! : > ItÂ´s a good idea to combine hotel business with art and using the hotel as a small gallery ...! I also liked the rooms, because of the dark wooden furnitures ... The rooms had been cleaned regulary, so that you had a fresh feeling when you opened the door. We had dinner on the terrace outside .... and we enjoyed the cosy atmosphere as well as the good service! The hotel staff is absoluteley attentive and always asked if erverything is ok. The choice of court had taken our taste ... very extraordinary!! The breakfast was also very extensive ... my favourite were the little dutch "Poffertjes" ..... So finally I can say that we were very satisfied and we would recommend Artemis hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: keira27
Reviews.Content: The hotel was stunning. The staff were very friendly and the room were stunning. Even though the hotel is about 20 mins away from the city centre by tram or bus its well worth it as you see so much of the city. The tram stop is about a 5 min walk and runs til 1am after that there are 24hr buses. I would defo recommend it, its about 10 mins from the airport which is good if you have an early morning flight. They have a free shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel which is fab.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance? not quite as good as i was hoping.”
Reviews.Author: scirby
Reviews.Content: I got a good price on this hotel and after seeing the website was excited about staying there and my expectations were pretty high for a "Designer" four star hotel. Things got off to a bad start when instead of getting a "double" room I was checked into a room with just a sofa bed/couch. I was very disappointed that a four star hotel could not even provide a "real bed". The room was nice and clean and perfectly decent, all apart from the lack of a real bed. I felt like because I got a deal on line and was a solo traveler I was being shoved into a small annex room of a suite, like the children's room or something, especially as the room had an adjoining door to another room and had no bed!. I asked to be moved to a different room shortly after i had checked in. I had to spend the first night in this sofa bed room. The hotel did not seem particularly full so i'm sure they could have found another room. I managed to get moved into a double room for the remaining nights. I was told to leave my luggage in the first room and that it would be moved to my new room and I could pick up the keys. When I came back to the hotel to get my new room key the agent knew nothing of my request to move rooms and my luggage had not been moved anywhere and was still sat in the first room. I had to go back to my old room and move my bags myself to the new room. Having worked at a hotel front desk myself I can understand the communication breakdown at the desk, but I would expect to at least be offered help with my bags and it was just a little bit of hassle that could have been avoided. The staff were reasonably friendly and helpful and answered queries about transport to and from the hotel. They dealt with the issue of my room quickly and efficiently apart from the passing of information from one agent on the am shift to the agent on the pm shift. The double room i was moved to for the rest of my stay was good, nice and clean apart from a stain on the duvet. The breakfast was average for the fairly expensive price, a reasonable selection of food but still a bit of a let down for the price tag. Transport from the hotel to the city and airport was straight forward and cheap and the location was nice and quiet. The bicycle hire was good value and easy to arrange too. For the price I paid my stay was adequate, just spoiled by the lack of a proper bed upon check in. I expected slightly better service and a better quality breakfast at a "designer" four star hotel of this price/standard. I would recommend this hotel only if you get a good deal, as you can probably get a similar standard of hotel at a similar price nearer the city. The hotel is nice inside and the designer aspect of it and furniture is different and interesting as is the art work in the hotel but at the end of the day good service a good nights sleep and good food are what you want when you stay at a hotel. This hotel did cover the basics but not to quite the standard i was expecting. More facilities at a slightly cheaper price would compensate for this hotel being slightly out of the city and would make it much more attractive to me for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... but”
Reviews.Author: Sinalsa
Reviews.Content: Don't go if you want to be in the heart of the city it is not so close. Tram will take 30-35 minutes (including the time you need to reach the tram stop). Bus stop is near the hotel but buses arrive every half an hour. We paid around 69-79 euro for the night which was on an internet offer and a good price for the hotel. The price did not include breakfast which was VERY expensive (20 euro per person) without being anything special. The normal price 140-150 euro without breakfast seemed a little bit too much, but then again is a 4* hotel. You can rent bicycles from the hotel (the simple ones) and use them to go to the center for 10 euro per day (cheaper solutions exist in the city especially for bigger renting periods) which was a great experience, the way to the center is big but easy to do (50+ min). The return is a little bit harder. You will need a good map for not loosing the way. The location of the hotel is perfect for travellers that want to rent a car and explore a little bit more about Holland than simply go to Amsterdam, yet parking is expensive (15euro p.d.) but it is expensive all around Holland. Free Wi-Fi was one more reason for our selection. Minor details that did not affect our holidays but added black spots. It's a 4 * hotel yet the sink was broken (cracked) (we told and made a report of the damage), the curtains where ripped off (probably from the window) and the room-service never reffiled the coffee-tea-sugar box without us complaining first. My wife also complained that they only once changed the bedding a night before we left (and we stayed for 8 nights there).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent..location ..public transport..quited and clean area ..hotel is beutiful”
Reviews.Author: thetravelleragain
Reviews.Content: Our stay at your hotrel was surprisingly pleasant and we got more than what we thought. The hotel maybe 20-25mins from Dam square and a bit nearer to Leidsplein,but the transport made up for that . itr was so easu and convenient to get the tram, and the night bus. so your not really out of the way. We received 25% off the breakfast which was really nice. and the rooms were so clean. We will definately recommend your hotel and we have booked to come back with other travel agents in August. Thank you very much for such a pleasanr stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Distant”
Reviews.Author: Tology
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel as part of a package via LastMinute.com, and it was a 'Secret Hotel'. I was therefore quite pleased when I found out what hotel I'd be staying at, and indeed the hotel itself did turn out to be very nice. It's clean, plush and nice and quiet. Most of the staff were very helpful. However, initially, after arriving at 12:30, I was told the room wouldn't be ready until 14:00 (fair enough), but that I could pay â‚¬40 to go there earlier. I declined, but when the Manager saw me hanging, he said I could go to my room straight away at no extra cost. Whilst this is nice, it does demonstrate that the â‚¬40 charge they would have taken had I accepted was unjustified. The only real issue I have with this hotel was, like many others, the fact that it is a fair way out of the city centre. You need to get a 30 minute bus or tram journey there (the latter requires a 10 minute walk to the tram stop). There is a bus stop right outside the hotel, though be aware that if you purchase an iAmsterdam Card, this will not cover you for this bus, as it's run by Connexion, rather than GVB. However, the nearest GVB bus is still very close to the hotel. Internet is free throughout the hotel, and my room had air-conditioning and a safe. I was not charged a deposit for the fridge. Unsure whether I was the exception or other other person who was charged was, but I certainly wasn't charged. Overall, very happy with the hotel, but just be prepared for a bit of travelling.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful & stylish”
Reviews.Author: SamSamDublin
Reviews.Content: when booking the hotel i was told it was ten mins from dam square this was a big mistake on the travel agents point and not the hotels, The hotel is big spacious with amazing decor, as i had booked true an agent and prepaid, still a deposit of 100 euro was required, which was a bit off putting! as money was required the min we arrived. Our room was lovely very modern with a HUGE bed, which was very comfortable. :). the hotel does have a restaurant but not a great selection on offer, we decided to order from the room service menu, whcih was great! and plenty off it. breakfast was included in our rate, it consist of breads tea coffee's eggs bacon ect which was an extra cost , mini bar is very expensive â‚¬16 for two can's of cola, i was shocked! Free internet Wifi was brilliant big plus! The reception team were helpfull, with directions ect. its about 20 mins on the tram which bring you right into the city, you can also buy the ticket at reception which was very hand, we also didnt mind travelling in and out as we were only there for two days. We had a great stay lovely and relaxing. will be returning

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, above average hotel”
Reviews.Author: markpb
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Artemis for three days in June for a work meeting. It's convenient to the Metro (10 minute walk) and the Tram (5 minute walk) and about 20 minutes from the centre of Amsterdam. The hotel is nice and the rooms are comfortable. My only complaints would be the restaurant (very poor dinner menu, an almost non-existent desert menu and really slow service even though I was on of two people there) and the pillows (lifeless). I couldn't find anywhere nearby to eat either so the restaurant is a bit of a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Rather cold!”
Reviews.Author: drdave23
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong: The "Artemis Amsterdam" is a pretty nice hotel but there are certain things that you should keep in mind when booking. If you are on a leisure trip and want to experience all the highlights of the this wonderful city you should be prepared to spend between 20 to 30 minutes on buses into town. The hotel is located half way between the city center and Schiphol International within a newly built business district. The atmosphere is rather dull and cold. There isn't too much else to say about this place except for the fact that their breakfast is extremely expensive (around 15 euros pp) for this kind of a hotel while their parking garage seems to be a bargain compared to the prices that you usually pay in Amsterdam: To make it short: Good hotel without any charme, though. Not the best address for active tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but cold atmosphere...”
Reviews.Author: usand100
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my wife and 2 of her colleagues. We arrived at this hotel at 9.30 am. We started the check-in, but one lady at reception-desk (I believe she was the Front Office Manager) told us that if we want to check-in we have to pay an early check-in fee. The fist lady was quite nice until the other one appeared; she didnâ€™t mention any tax, but she was a little terrorized. I refused to pay anything, not necessarily because of the amount (she didnâ€™t mention how much this tax will be), but because I was disturb of the way she put this. Itâ€™s important to know that the first lady had already magnetized our cardsâ€¦ Second of all, I was disturbed of the fact she asked us to guarantee with the credit card, or 100 EUR cash, for mini bar products. I am Romanian (proud of it in spite of general European opinion) and probably this was the reason she asked this guaranteeâ€¦ Back in Romania I realized she blocked me 180 EUR, and 3 days after I left Amsterdam I didnâ€™t recovered themâ€¦ In spite of this incident at beginning, the 3 days I spent at your hotel were very nice, the breakfast was very good, cleanliness the same. All the others receptionists were very nice and tried to help us, if we asked them.

Reviews.Title: “practical - nice design - bit remote”
Reviews.Author: mini2006
Reviews.Content: just been there for a business trip, so including meeting rooms etc. Rooms - NH lookalike, all practical, bit designy, pleasant without being spectacular Lobby -Bar- Restaurants - some very nice design pieces (off course a matter of taste) Stafff- friendly, maybe a bit slow Food - Meeting lunches - good average restaurant cuisine Remote to the city - but quick from the airport. Bottomline - would not be my favorite for a city trip, because of the distance to the city (20 min taxi) but a very ok place for people that do not mind that.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel-too far from the action”
Reviews.Author: DickieB77
Reviews.Content: I've read many of the previous reviews. I'm not sure what the expectation is but if your expectation is to be in a business hotel 40-60 minutes outside of the city this fits the bill. The rooms are in line with a business class European hotel; small by American standards but with the expected amenities. The free wi fi is a definate plus not expected in Europe. The strongest point in favor of this hotel is the breakfast. Our room included the breakfast and was paid for by the company. Normally, I believe breakfast is quite pricey so if youâ€™re thinking staying here, and of course you care about breakfast, try to negotiate breakfast into the room price. Hotel breakfast includes unlimited espressos and cappuccinos, croissants, fruit, pancakes, smoked salmon, local meat and cheese, eggs, bacon, juice, etc. A very nice spread and Iâ€™ve eaten at a lot of hotel buffets. There is nothing close by for eating establishments so plan to eat dinner in Amsterdam. No comment on the hotel for dinner as I didnâ€™t eat there. The hotel has a small fitness center, tread mill, bike some minor amounts of weights. Not much. Everything from this hotel is a drive or a tram ride. I read amount service comments. There are some bad apples here, basically some youthful slackers but I felt they were contained and didnâ€™t impact me. On check in my wife commented that the clerk was a bit curt. However they let us check in at 8 in the morning and didnâ€™t charge us a second day which was also unexpected. This is big deal as we were both exhausted from the flight. We hit the bed at 8 AM ish and slept until 4 PM without any disturbance. If youâ€™re coming from the US, check this out. The WSJ did a piece a few years ago about London hotels that wouldnâ€™t let people check in until 3PM. So I think a very nice feature. The worst thing about this hotel is its location. A five to ten minute walk gets you to the tram station. From there you wait. There is a schedule but essentially a tram comes every 10 minutes or so. Thus, the wait isnâ€™t that bad. The tram ride is 30 minutes to a major tourist area. It runs right through central Amsterdam so you can get to most everything with a straight shot of a tram ride. The museum district, the dam, and the main train station are on the route. The hotel staff are not very helpful in terms of traditional concierge service. Essentially youâ€™ll get a very marginal amount of assistance compared to a concierge at a Four Seasons or Ritz. They try marginally to help and are polite but not very knowledgeable. So all considered, I would rate this as a three star hotel. The service is not great but not horrible. The rooms are reasonably clean. Proper amenities are applied for the style of hotel expected. The restaurant appears to be well stocked and in line with a higher caliper facility. Workout facilities are basic and there is no outside gym option. Attractions are too far away and add a hassle that, if you pay $300 plus a night, you shouldnâ€™t have to deal with. In my mind, this is a hotel for people stuck on a layover from the airport who are going to stay one night and clear out. From that perspective, it is aces. The other group here would be tour groups on group rates. Tours can tout the "5 star" hotel BS and one could argue it loosely fits the tour guide description. From a critical view, this is puely a thee star location. From any other view point, I have to think anyone who recommends this hotel just hasnâ€™t traveled enough or experienced enough of the other options available given the hotelâ€™s price point. There are far better options inside the city with easy access to the sights you came to see at better price points, so why bother with this place?

Reviews.Title: “absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: higgins31
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel ,my hubby and i ,and i must say ,it was the most beautiful ,welcoming clean comfrtable hotel,i ever stayed in,. We used most of the facilities ,including room service for my hubbys birthday ,which he really enjoyed ,loads of vareity and and very tasty,we also used the bar most nights and the staff were lovely,and the restaurant food was most delicious,service was great all round ,i can not wait to come back ,and didnt mind the distance as it fun using the tram and bus ,. Thank you for agreat time and what agreat look it is throu out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel overall, if a little pricey.”
Reviews.Author: myprettymouth
Reviews.Content: Hotel Artemis blew me away, what a gorgeous hotel. The room was fully equipt and clean, the food was great, the room service was great. The only complaints I have relate to the restaurant and bar- 14 euro for 2 drinks was excessive and the restaurant staff were incredibly unprofessional; they seemed not to know what they were doing and were very slow in bringing us drinks, our bill, etc. The hotel is a bit out of Amsterdam city centre, but it was easy to get the 145 bus behind the hotel to Leidsplein which was in walking distance from all the sites, or 10 minutes down the road to get the metro station where you get line 51 until station rai then change to 50 which takes you straight to centraal. I would stay again because it was such a beautiful hotel, but next time I might try something a little more down market to be closer to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, horrible location”
Reviews.Author: TexasWorker
Reviews.Content: It describes itself as a design hotel, but there were very few touches making me think of it as that. The room was spacious, but staff was mediocre. Because of a flight delay, I arrived later than I expected and they had canceled my reservation (even though I pre-paid). It took almost an hour to get it resolved. My biggest problem was that the hotel is quite a distance from any restaurant or attraction. It's a bit of a walk to the tram and metro stations, and several minutes to get anywhere from there.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad option”
Reviews.Author: Thousandeurist
Reviews.Content: It is located 30 minutes walking from downtown, but there is public transportation to make your life easy, and always you can haul a taxi (average 15 Euro). The hotel is clean and nice, although is, somehow, already old-fashion. I though some years ago should had been a superb place, boutique style, but time has gone by, and what was avant-garde 8 years ago, today is kind of cheesy. Staff is not truly helpful; they have this frozen-fake smile that makes you thinking they are pretending. If the tariff is reasonable, it is a good alternative to the extremely pricing and not always worthy hotels in the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Good, modern hotel, reasonable price but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: eteo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night and found the hotel to be new, clean with modern decor. Free wireless internet but no breakfast included in the basic price. If you are without your own transport then the trams are quite a walk away. My wife and I were very comfortable for the 1 night stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business”
Reviews.Author: itzard
Reviews.Content: Yes, the tv is bad and yes the room service isn't great and yes it's quit a long way from the centre of town, but..... If you're looking for a nice business hotel, one that actually provides nice and quiet rooms and doens't cost more then 150 a night during week days, this is it. I've been to most business hotels in Masterdam and most are comparable and some are better, i.e. the Hitlon or Westin, but most are almost twice as expensive during weekdays and are often fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Near the airport , 20 minutes from centre”
Reviews.Author: Salonic
Reviews.Content: I peronally think that Artemis is a nice hotel . It is located very near the airport (take bus 195 to avoid excessive taxi rates ) . However it is not near the city centre (it is about 20 minutes with tram number 2 - station of tram is 5 min walk from hotel ) . Rooms are clean , there is lot of space, cable TV , and all amenities a traveller would require. As regards surroundings , i think the hotel is in an area the gives the impression you are in the country rather than in a city. A lot of green , many ducks, we even run into a rabbit once. Hotel staff is friendly. In general it is good value for money, i think it is a very economical hotel , as compared to other hotels in Amsterdam of the same class, and quality of rooms and service are high . !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but EXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: Desi_traveler_77
Reviews.Content: There are many mixed reviews about this hotel so hopely this one will be somewhat informative. First of all the hotel is located quite some distance from the city center. If you need to get there from the amsterdam train station it is Tram #2. (In an altered state at night the night bus is #358) You can also take the metro, but its quite a walk from the metro station, about 2 miles. Its located somewhat between Amsterdam city center and the airport. Its in the same building complex with IBM and other corporations. The hotel itself is very interesting. The front desk staff is not the nicest. Not quite rude, but somewhat arrogant. Once we got to our room, i have to say it was nice. The only room left was a smoking room on the 8th floor costing 138 euro. Very Very expensive, but somewhat average amongst the other amsterdam hotels. The room was nice with a double bed and a flat screen TV. The bathroom was also very nice with standard ammenities. The room comes equiped with a mini-bar, and pay-per-view movies (12 euro each). Overall, not a bad hotel. The distance from city center is significant but honestly it is still very accessable by Tram or night bus requiring just a short walk. The neighborhood is very safe and quiet so it was not at all a concern. If the price wasn't so high and staff wasn't soo stuck up, i would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not bad hotel but too far out”
Reviews.Author: Girlgoyle
Reviews.Content: The Artemis Hotel is perfectly nice inside. The staff were relatively friendly (they smiled) and checked us in and out fairly quickly. The room was perfectly fine, very comfy bed, excellent toiletries, stocked minibar, air con. Nice flat screen TV with a selection of music tracks. All in all I'd say it's a nice hotel, however, the location is not great if you're wanting to go into the city. It's located pretty close to the airport and is a good 20 mins tram ride away. It's in a business district with no bars, cafes or amenities surrounding and is a bit isolated with no atmosphere. Perfect for business guests who want to stay near the airport, but not for tourists wanting a weekend getaway to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: Liassic
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel as I was working nearby. The hotel looks OK and is clean and well built. However, this hotel is all about style rather than making your stay a good one. Things I didn't like: 1. Slow check-in. 2. Check-in staff with a bad attitude. 3. A restaurant menu that's all about presentation rather than giving you a good meal. As a traveller I want to arrive and have a good quick, filling meal. The menu here is all about looking good. 4. Poor veggie meal selection - the only veggie option was "asparagus risotto". 5. Restaurant staff who prefer to hide out of site behind the bar rather than be out serving diners. 6. Slow restaurant service - we arrived at 9pm and left at 11:30pm even though we were in a hurry. 7. Check-out take ages even though I was the only person in the queue. How can check-out take so long? I didn't have breakfast as it was â‚¬17.50. I'm not going to pay a fortune for a couple of pieces of bread and a coffee. However, my colleague regretted going for breakfast, as they were missing bowls, spoons and the queue for the single coffee machine was 20 people long. This hotel could easily be a pleasure to stay in but at the moment it's more of a pain.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travel_mad83
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - stayed here for one night in August 07 with three friends. Its modern, clean, new and really special. The breakfast was amazing and the staff great. Its quite far out of Dam centre but the tram is just down the end of the road. i wouldn't stay here again if I was only in dam for 1 or two nights as I would prefer to be in the centre Anything longer though and I would definitely stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but lacks substance”
Reviews.Author: Pifflove
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel. Affordable. Bed's are reasonable comfortable but could be stiffer. A little bit too far from the tram. MAJOR PROBLEM: The cleaning staff. Most importantly, they stole 50 euros from my wallet. And the wallet was not in plain sight. It was burried in my backpack which was in my suitcase. Not at all thorough, took away used bottles of cream and shampoo without replacing them. The top cover of the bed was made but the underlying sheets were left rumpled and untouched.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, indifferent location”
Reviews.Author: EamonnHarrigan
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel - nice layout, well furnished, interesting decor. It's downfall is its location - on the outskirts of Amsterdam in a business ara between the city and the airport. I took my girlfriend here and I chose it for its arty-boutiqueness but in truth I woud have been better off choosing a traditional, central old-fashioned hotel in the city centre. T hat's not to criticise the hotel - the staff were fine and it is well designed and a good place to be in. It's just its location lends itslef more to the busines traveller than the tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a little far removed”
Reviews.Author: JodiScott
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel and had nice rooms but we had some trouble with the staff on arrival as they originally gave us a twin room which we complained about as we had booked a queen room and they were not very accommodating about changing this for us. we eventually got it altered though and the service the rest of the time was great. The pillows on the bed are RUBBISH! but other than those minor misdemeanours, its a nice hotel though a bit far from the city centre. it takes 10mins to walk to the tram and then about 15-20 mins on the tram. breakfast is 17euro50!! so we didn't eat it. we just got something once we got into town. great and cheap place to eat in china town just behind the red light district is "eat mode", great food and very inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, rubish staff!”
Reviews.Author: johnc86
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I already knew first hand that this hotel was a bit of a distance from the centre of Amsterdam, we had stayed there before. Two years ago give or take a couple of months. We where impressed enough to return to the Artemis by the modern spacious design, the adequate fresh clean rooms and the excellent buffet style *FULL* cooked breakfast included in the price. On this first stay we had found one member of reception staff (who checked us in) to be quite unwelcoming almost to the point of being rudely abrupt. However, we never thought much of this and the rest of the stay was perfect. We stayed again this year (from the 1st Jan 08 in fact!). Whilst some aspects of the hotel where the same, the general appearance and well maintained quality feel of the room and the rest of hotel remained, other aspects had without a shadow of doubt, got worse. When we arrived at the hotel at around 9am, we intended to get a couple of hours sleep to top up the few hours we had managed to get before our early flight. We where told that the check in time (earliest) was 2pm. We looked, and this was indeed stated in small print on the reservation form. Whilst of course it was not the receptionists fault at all, and we where fine with coming back to check after 2pm, it was the way she dealt with us which concerned us. She was very unsympathetic and inhospitable towards us. We ourselves had to suggest simple things like leaving our luggage in the hotel until check in, and filling out our forms and necessary details in advance so she could have our room ready as quickly as possible when we returned after 2pm (we still intended to catch those couple of hours sleep before seeing some Amsterdam nightlife). When we returned at *5pm* to check in things got worse. We stood at the reception desk for *TEN MINUTES* looking at the*TWO* receptionists behind the desk and trying to make them engage with us or at least say that they would be with us in a minute or anything just to acknowledge that we where standing there waiting. They *BOTH* continued however to deal with a rich European woman who was also it seemed still waiting to check in. When we finally got seen to by the frosty female receptionist, we explained that we had already given our details and signed check in forms that morning. She left us waiting for a further 5 minutes before the guy asked us all the same questions. It turned out the girl earlier had messed up and had left the form lying around or something. When they eventually found the it, the guy said (after trying to charge us a further 100 euroâ€™s for a deposit we had already paid) that we would have to wait to check in as â€œthe system was downâ€�. He gave us 2 free drinks (one each lol) at the bar whilst (he said) he would fix the problem as soon as he could. Another 20 minutes past. We had long finished out tiny Artemis cocktails (he specified which drinks we could have!), so I suggested to him we WOULD be having another complimentary drink which he agreed to. When we eventually checked in the room was clean and fresh as was the bathroom to the credit of the cleaning staff. The other problem id' like to mention will no doubt seem very petty to some of you but let me explain. Remember, we had stayed here before and the things we liked about the hotel where why we returned for a second stay. The breakfast before had included hash browns, tomatoes, and a selection of eggs (not just scrambled). Worse still we where told at check in that the breakfast service would finish at 11am. We went down at about 10:15am to find that breakfast was (for a reason which nobody bothered to explain to us) finishing at 10:30am instead of 11am. Again the staff where very defensive about this and again not apologetic in the slightest! They where taking away trays of food whilst people where coming down to eat!!! The earlier time was the same for the whole stay. From reading other reviews it would seem that the rudeness of the staff at the Artemis is a problem for lots of people. A smile and polite hospitable attitude are expected from hotel staff the world over. It isnâ€™t allot to ask for. (*pleas read*) What we are most upset about is that we missed pretty much a day of our stay in Amsterdam because when we finally checked at 6pm, we fell asleep and didnâ€™t wake until the next morning as we where so tired. This is a nice Hotel but I wouldnâ€™t give them any more of my money in the future. For a 4 star Hotel they lack allot of hospitality and simple etiquette.

Reviews.Title: “Grotesque overrated - try somewhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: spirou1172
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night only. No one at the entrance to meet and care for your luggage (remember: 4*-hotel). Hotel is far from central town, expect 30 minutes to get to citiy centre by foot and tram. But especialy the service is totally incompetent: After our arrival we complained about the tidyness of the bathroom - there were e.g. disgusting stains on the toilet - to the staff at the reception. The guy there seemed to be irritated that we couldnt name the exact spot that was to be cleaned but asked for a second "run through" by the houeskeeping through the bathroom. He promised to care anyway. When we got back in the night the bath was no cleaner than in the afternoon. The Parking is - comparing to the distance to Shiphol and City centre - much too expensive (15 â‚¬ the day). Too sum it up: A nice surface but with imcompetence beneath. Don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - quiet location”
Reviews.Author: sar86
Reviews.Content: the hotel was nice, very modern and stylishly decorated. didnt spend too much time there as was to-ing and fro-ing in and out of town, which is about a 15-20 walk away or you can just jump on a tram around the corner from the hotel. ideal for business travellers who dont want to be in the hustle and bustle of the city centre. beware of taxi drivers they will rob you blind!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and hip”
Reviews.Author: y0adrienne
Reviews.Content: Hotel Artemis was everything we were looking for in a hotel. Large, comfortable room with all the amenities, excellent restaurant, and a well-above-average breakfast buffet. The staff made a mistake with the Design Package we'd booked but quickly corrected the situation. Parking was expensive (15,60 euro for 24 hours), and the nearest tram stop is a ten-minute walk, but other than that it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Nids
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have booked to stay at this hotel in November and it will be our third time here at The Artemis. We dont mind at all the 20 min tram ride into central Amsterdam, as it really is such a comfortable hotel. Ok the surroundings arent the best (with the business park) but the hotel does make up for that with its comfort and style. We would recommend a great company called travelrepublic to book with. Through them we've recently booked 2 nights for Â£116 (per room) and that includes breakfast. We've used travelrepublic before and have got it even cheaper! The only negative would be the TV channels but apart from that, its a great place and no doubt we would stay there again! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with unfriendly and untrained staff”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_Bateman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is recently opened and therefore the rooms are very new and clean. The design concept is nice and the rooms and the hotel is well decorated. The bar and the food are both very good. The hotel is outside in a business area, so you should only stay here, when you are on business trip or have a car. The really bad thing about this hotel is the staff. They are very lazy, untrained and unfriendly. Did not fill up minibar, takes them ages to do soemthing (e.g. get the bill, help you with luggage ...), when you are complaining they are just laughing at you... it is really terrible - therefor I would never return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and new hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: redivan666
Reviews.Content: We were on a short scape for 4 days in Amsterdam for tourism (i went with my girlfriend) and we were looking for a comfortable hotel, secure and easy to get to it from the airport. It was really a nice price for the hotels in Amsterdam but you have to "pay" for it being in an industrial suburb of the city. I mean industrial because it is a kind of park full of companies such as IBM and more, but it is really close to another neighbourhood were people live apart from the city chaos. The hotel is very very new, with an styilish design and very modern. It took as a little ride in the bus from the airport which lead us to the door of the hotel. It is out of the city noise but indeed out of the centre of Amsterdam but it was nothing problematic due to the fantastic tram service which is 5 minutes walk from the hotel. It took us around 20 minutes to get to the center but we used to spend all day out of the room so it was perfect for us. We were on a weekend and the monday and tuesday after and there were no noise from the outside during week days. The room was huge and we had a nice flat tv and a nice bathroom as well. Everything was perfectly clean and the bed was very comfortable and wide. If you are looking for something in the middle of everything, this is NOT your place but if you are looking for a new, comfy and modern hotel with all the good things and apart from noise and shared bathrooms this is your choice.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: ygtai
Reviews.Content: I stayed there two nights at the end of August 2007. It is in a business park and surrounded by constructions. To me it was ok and it was not noisy. However, admittedly, I stayed there only in the evening just for sleep. I slept well. The hotel itself looked good. I did not use any other services or facilities except wireless internet, nor any meal there. The refrigerator contained pay drinks only and was not for guest use. Depending on your purpose, the location might be a problem, but a minor problem IMO. It is half way from the airport to downtown. It takes about 20 mins to the central station by tram #2, of which the stop is around 5-10 mins on foot from the hotel. It is reasonably acceptable if you're used to live in a city bigger than Amsterdam, especially considering that it's more cheaper than hotels of the same class in downtown. Bus #195 takes you to the airport from the hotel in about 10-20 mins. I took the bus to the airport and then took the train from there to The Hague and Delft. If you carefully plan your connections, you will be in The Hague in about an hour, cheaper and probably faster than starting off from a downtown hotel. Overall that was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: ncoups
Reviews.Content: sharing a room with a pal, it cost us Â£2 each per night which is really quite reasonable for a nice hotel. beds were comfy and food was nice. staff were a little rude though and beer was about Â£4.50 a pint. Bus into central amsterdam was worth it for the savings we made id say.

Reviews.Title: “nice place - bad location”
Reviews.Author: adam321pink
Reviews.Content: While this is a nice hotel we would not really reccomend for a trip to see amsterdam centre unless you have a car or a lot of cash for taxis! Its a long way out and while the metro and train run regular its a good 10 min walk to the station, not really what you want at night. The rooms are nice something similar to a tulip inn. The decor is refreshing but not spectacular. the resturant food is good but not a lot of choice and the hotel bar is not the best, no atmosphere. The staff are friendly and helpful. The place is ok for business but not really suited to a holiday break as nothing to do and 30 euros away from anything interesting.

Reviews.Title: “All facilities fully booked”
Reviews.Author: kelly43Ireland
Reviews.Content: We booked a weekend stay in the Artemis Hotel in November 2006. On our arrival, we were told that all the facilities (restaurant etc) were fully booked by a Corporate event happening nearby. It was suggested we either use room service or the sister hotel located miles away with no transport! As neither were great choices, we had to arrange taxis to take us for all meals. I wrote to complain but was met with a useless response. Staff poor, location poor, hotel standard (rooms etc) adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Location not an issue - awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: scrowley
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very art-chique, and for Holland had good sized rooms, beds and bathroom. Very, very clean and modern, the restaurant had some good food but best is the interior design. We found it a little hard to find, and it IS a bit out of centre, but the #2 tram takes you RIGHT into the centre every 10 minutes, and the night bus works great for those coming home late. The service was *amazing* at this hotel and I would definitely stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Artemis Hotel Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: John M Keynesplein 2, Amsterdam 1066 EP, The Netherlands
